questions.text: Which of the following can be used endometrial biopsy as an OPD procedure?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Pipelle aspirator

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Pipelle aspirator is the preferred instrument for performing an endometrial biopsy in an outpatient setting due to its minimally invasive nature and lack of need for cervical dilation, providing a simple, effective, and relatively painless option for biopsy.
  • ➤ Pipelle aspirator

questions.text: A 23y woman presents to the OPD 6 weeks following delivery. She had a PPIUCD inserted and is now concerned she can’t feel the thread. An ultrasound is ordered, and the 3-D USG image is as shown below. What is the next best step?

options.label: D
options.text: Removal of Cu T with IUCD hook

questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Reassurance

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases where a patient with a PPIUCD cannot feel the thread, an ultrasound is used to confirm the device's placement. If the IUCD is in place and there are no complications, reassurance is the appropriate next step, as the missing thread does not affect the function of the IUCD.
  • ➤ PPIUCD
  • ➤ reassurance

questions.text: Match the procedure with the diagnosis:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) a-3, b-2, c-1, d-4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In pelvic organ prolapse, the surgical approach depends on the patient’s age, marital/childbearing status, and the type of prolapse. Laparoscopic hysteropexy is often used for younger women who wish to preserve their uterus, while older women with severe prolapse may benefit from sacrocolpopexy or vaginal hysterectomy with anterior colporrhaphy .
  • ➤ Laparoscopic hysteropexy
  • ➤ sacrocolpopexy
  • ➤ vaginal hysterectomy with anterior colporrhaphy

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding tamoxifen is true?

options.label: A
options.text: It acts as an estrogen agonist in the breast and uterus

options.label: B
options.text: Tamoxifen use has been linked to endometrial polyps, hyperplasia, and carcinoma but not to uterine sarcomas

options.label: C
options.text: Women using tamoxifen should undergo evaluation for endometrial cancer if symptoms of bleeding develop

options.label: D
options.text: It is a selective estrogen-receptor modulator (SERM) used as an adjunct for treatment of estrogen-receptor negative breast cancer

questions.correct_answer: C. Women using tamoxifen should undergo evaluation for endometrial cancer if symptoms of bleeding develop
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Women using tamoxifen should undergo evaluation for endometrial cancer if symptoms of bleeding develop

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Tamoxifen , a SERM, acts as an estrogen antagonist in the breast and an agonist in the uterus, increasing the risk of endometrial hyperplasia , polyps , carcinoma , and even uterine sarcoma . Women on tamoxifen who develop abnormal uterine bleeding must be evaluated for endometrial cancer .
  • ➤ Tamoxifen
  • ➤ endometrial hyperplasia
  • ➤ polyps
  • ➤ carcinoma
  • ➤ uterine sarcoma
  • ➤ abnormal uterine bleeding
  • ➤ endometrial cancer

questions.text: What type of leiomyoma is shown in this sonographic image?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Subserous

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A subserous fibroid primarily grows outward from the uterus and does not affect the endometrial cavity. Identifying the relationship between the fibroid and the uterine layers on imaging is crucial for diagnosing the type of fibroid.
  • ➤ subserous fibroid

questions.text: Your 48-year-old patient presents with complaints of worsening menorrhagia. She has no other medical problems. Three-dimensional sonographic evaluation reveals the findings as shown below. All except which of the following are suitable choices for medical treatment in this patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Levonorgestrel-releasing intrauterine system (LNGIUS)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Intrauterine devices (IUDs), including the levonorgestrel-releasing intrauterine system (LNGIUS), are contraindicated in patients with a distorted uterine cavity , such as from a submucosal fibroid. Other medical treatments like COCs, DMPA, and GnRH agonists are viable options for managing menorrhagia associated with fibroids.
  • ➤ Intrauterine devices (IUDs), including the levonorgestrel-releasing intrauterine system (LNGIUS), are contraindicated in patients with a distorted uterine cavity

questions.text: The sonographic “tip of the iceberg” sign corresponds to the site within a mature cystic teratoma where the most varied tissue types, such as hair and fatty secretions, are found. Pathologically, what is the name of this area?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Rokitansky protuberance

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Rokitansky protuberance is the part of a mature cystic teratoma where diverse tissue types such as hair, fat, and sometimes bone or teeth are found. The "tip of the iceberg" sign on ultrasound is due to the echogenic appearance of these materials, which can obscure deeper structures.
  • ➤ Rokitansky protuberance
  • ➤ "tip of the iceberg" sign

questions.text: Which of the following tumor antigens is correctly paired with its ovarian tumor or malignancy?

options.label: D
options.text: Lactate dehydrogenase (LDH)—yolk sac tumor and embryonal cell carcinoma

questions.correct_answer: C. Cancer antigen 19-9 (CA19-9)—mucinous epithelial ovarian carcinoma
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Cancer antigen 19-9 (CA19-9)—mucinous epithelial ovarian carcinoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ CA19-9 is associated with mucinous epithelial ovarian carcinoma , while other tumor markers like CA-125 are linked to serous ovarian cancers, AFP with yolk sac tumors, and LDH with dysgerminomas.
  • ➤ CA19-9
  • ➤ mucinous epithelial ovarian carcinoma
  • ➤ CA-125
  • ➤ AFP
  • ➤ LDH

questions.text: All except which of the following are appropriate medical treatments for adenomyosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Copper intrauterine device

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The copper IUD is contraindicated for adenomyosis due to its potential to increase bleeding, while hormonal therapies like COCs , NSAIDs , and LNG-IUS are effective in managing the symptoms of adenomyosis, including heavy menstrual bleeding and dysmenorrhea.
  • ➤ copper IUD
  • ➤ contraindicated
  • ➤ hormonal therapies
  • ➤ COCs
  • ➤ NSAIDs
  • ➤ LNG-IUS

questions.text: Which of the following is the most likely etiology for infertility in women with endometriosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Tubal obstruction

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In women with endometriosis , infertility is most often due to tubal obstruction caused by pelvic adhesions and scarring, which impede egg transport and fertilization. Ovulation typically remains unaffected, but tubal and pelvic dysfunction plays a central role in infertility associated with this condition.
  • ➤ endometriosis
  • ➤ tubal obstruction

questions.text: A 14-year-old female presents with increasingly painful, cyclic menses since menarche 9 months ago. Oral analgesics and nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory medications no longer adequately control her dysmenorrhea. Which of the following congenital anomalies is most likely present?

options.label: A
options.text: Obstructed hemivagina and ipsilateral renal anomaly (OHVIRA) syndrome

questions.correct_answer: A. Obstructed hemivagina and ipsilateral renal anomaly (OHVIRA) syndrome
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Obstructed hemivagina and ipsilateral renal anomaly (OHVIRA) syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ OHVIRA syndrome (obstructed hemivagina and ipsilateral renal anomaly) presents with progressively worsening dysmenorrhea as menstrual blood accumulates in the obstructed hemivagina. It is associated with uterine didelphys and ipsilateral renal agenesis . Symptoms of cyclic pain with normal menstruation are key features distinguishing it from conditions like imperforate hymen and Mullerian agenesis.
  • ➤ OHVIRA syndrome
  • ➤ uterine didelphys
  • ➤ ipsilateral renal agenesis

questions.text: A 13-year-old female presents with increasing abdominal pain. She has begun appropriate pubertal development, although menarche has not occurred. During examination, a central abdominopelvic mass is appreciated. Physical examination findings prompt sonography and then magnetic resonance (MR) imaging with contrast. The MR imaging results are shown in the figure. Which of the following congenital anomalies is most likely present?

options.label: D
options.text: Obstructed hemivagina and ipsilateral renal anomaly

questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Imperforate hymen

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Imperforate hymen is a common cause of outflow obstruction leading to primary amenorrhea and cyclic abdominal pain in adolescents. It results in the accumulation of menstrual blood (hematocolpos) and presents with a palpable central pelvic mass. MR imaging can help confirm the diagnosis by showing the distended, fluid-filled vaginal cavity and displaced uterus.
  • ➤ Imperforate hymen

questions.text: Primary therapy for central (gonadotropin dependent) precocious puberty consists of which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) agonist

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The treatment of choice for central (gonadotropin-dependent) precocious puberty is GnRH agonists , which act to suppress early activation of the hypothalamic-pituitary-gonadal axis. This allows for controlled progression of puberty when the patient reaches the appropriate age.
  • ➤ central (gonadotropin-dependent) precocious puberty
  • ➤ GnRH agonists

questions.text: In the image below, which line corresponds to luteinizing hormone level changes during the menstrual cycle?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) C

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Luteinizing hormone (LH) peaks sharply just before ovulation, triggering the release of the egg. This surge is critical for the timing of ovulation in the menstrual cycle.
  • ➤ Luteinizing hormone (LH)

questions.text: Formation of endometrium pinopods, important for embryo implantation, is dependent on which of the following hormones?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Progesterone

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Progesterone is essential for preparing the endometrium for implantation by promoting the formation of pinopods , which are critical for embryo attachment and successful implantation.
  • ➤ Progesterone
  • ➤ pinopods

questions.text: A 20-year-old female is diagnosed with gonadal dysgenesis, and her karyotype reveals 45, X/46, XY mosaicism. Laparoscopy is performed for which of the foll:

options.label: A
options.text: Gonadectomy due to increased risk of malignant transformation in retained gonads

options.label: B
options.text: Oophoropexy due to increased rate of torsion

options.label: C
options.text: Endometriosis ablation due to increased rate of endometriosis

questions.correct_answer: A. Gonadectomy due to increased risk of malignant transformation in retained gonads
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Gonadectomy due to increased risk of malignant transformation in retained gonads

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In individuals with 45, X/46, XY mosaicism , there is a significant risk of malignant transformation of the dysgenetic gonads, necessitating prophylactic gonadectomy to prevent the development of gonadal tumors such as gonadoblastoma or dysgerminoma.
  • ➤ 45, X/46, XY mosaicism
  • ➤ malignant transformation
  • ➤ prophylactic gonadectomy

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding polycystic ovarian syndrome?

options.label: B
options.text: It is the most common cause of chronic anovulation

options.label: C
options.text: It is characterized by hypogonadotropic hypogonadism

options.label: D
options.text: It is characterized by persistently elevated follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) and estradiol levels

questions.correct_answer: B. It is the most common cause of chronic anovulation
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) It is the most common cause of chronic anovulation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ PCOS is the most common cause of chronic anovulation and typically presents with oligomenorrhea . It is associated with elevated LH and normal or low FSH , not hypogonadotropic hypogonadism.
  • ➤ PCOS
  • ➤ most common cause of chronic anovulation
  • ➤ oligomenorrhea
  • ➤ elevated LH
  • ➤ normal or low FSH

questions.text: Of the following conditions, which is most likely associated with the following finding?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Ovarian androgen-producing tumor

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Severe virilization (such as clitoromegaly) is most commonly caused by conditions that produce excessive androgens, such as an ovarian androgen-producing tumor . PCOS, while associated with hyperandrogenism, typically does not lead to clitoromegaly.
  • ➤ virilization
  • ➤ ovarian androgen-producing tumor

questions.text: Which of the following organs is correctly paired with its embryologic origin?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Testes and ovaries—genital ridge

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The testes and ovaries develop from the genital ridge , while the uterus originates from the paramesonephric ducts . The bladder develops from the urogenital sinus , and the kidney comes from the metanephros .
  • ➤ testes and ovaries
  • ➤ genital ridge
  • ➤ uterus
  • ➤ paramesonephric ducts
  • ➤ bladder
  • ➤ urogenital sinus
  • ➤ kidney
  • ➤ metanephros

questions.text: Which of the mullerian anomalies, as illustrated in ¨ this sonogram, has the best reproductive prognosis? A gestational sac is seen on the image’s left:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Uterine didelphys

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Uterine didelphys generally has the best reproductive prognosis among the listed Müllerian anomalies, although it can still be associated with reproductive challenges.
  • ➤ Uterine didelphys

questions.text: Which of the following hormones is thought to play a major role in ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Human chorionic gonadotropin (Hcg)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ HCG is the key hormone involved in ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome (OHSS) , and its administration should be carefully managed to prevent this condition, especially in the context of IVF cycles .
  • ➤ HCG
  • ➤ ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome (OHSS)
  • ➤ IVF cycles

questions.text: Which of the following is the best treatment for a woman with a significant decline in ovarian reserve?

options.label: D
options.text: In vitro fertilization (IVF) and intracytoplasmic sperm injection

questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Donor egg

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of significant decline in ovarian reserve , the best treatment option is typically the use of a donor egg to improve the chances of successful pregnancy. Other treatments like ovulation induction or IVF may not yield favorable outcomes due to poor egg quality and quantity.
  • ➤ significant decline in ovarian reserve
  • ➤ donor egg

questions.text: In the postmenopausal woman with uterine bleeding, evaluation of the endometrium may be accomplished by endometrial biopsy, hysteroscopy, or transvaginal sonography. Which of the following sonographic endometrial thickness measurements is commonly used as a threshold to indicate a low risk for endometrial hyperplasia or cancer?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 5 mm

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In postmenopausal women with uterine bleeding, an endometrial thickness of 5 mm or greater measured by transvaginal ultrasound warrants further investigation through endometrial biopsy to rule out hyperplasia or cancer.
  • ➤ endometrial thickness of 5 mm or greater
  • ➤ endometrial biopsy

questions.text: As shown in this image of vaginal prolapse, when the leading edge of bulge is approximately even with the plane of the hymen or within 1 cm distal to the hymen, a patient is said to have which stage of prolapse?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Stage II

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the POP-Q system , Stage II prolapse occurs when the prolapse reaches the level of the hymen or extends slightly (within 1 cm) below it.
  • ➤ POP-Q system
  • ➤ Stage II

questions.text: Which combination of agents is commonly used as adjuvant treatment of advanced epithelial ovarian cancer? Extensive omental involvement is seen here?

options.label: D
options.text: Etoposide, methotrexate, Adriamycin D, cyclophosphamide, Oncovin (EMA-CO)

questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Carboplatin, paclitaxel

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For advanced epithelial ovarian cancer , carboplatin and paclitaxel form the cornerstone of adjuvant chemotherapy following optimal surgical debulking. Platinum-based chemotherapy is key in reducing tumor recurrence and improving survival.
  • ➤ advanced epithelial ovarian cancer
  • ➤ carboplatin
  • ➤ paclitaxel

questions.text: During brachytherapy with tandem and ovoid use, the tandem fits into which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Uterus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In brachytherapy for cervical cancer, the tandem is inserted into the uterus , and the ovoid applicators are placed in the vaginal fornices to deliver precise radiation to the target areas.
  • ➤ brachytherapy
  • ➤ tandem
  • ➤ uterus
  • ➤ ovoid
  • ➤ vaginal fornices

questions.text: More than 100 human papillomavirus (HPV) types have been identified to date. Clinically, HPV types are classified as high risk (HR) or low risk based upon their oncogenic potential. Which two HR HPV types together account for approximately 70 percent of cervical cancers worldwide?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 16 and 18

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ HPV types 16 and 18 are responsible for 70% of cervical cancers , making them the most important high-risk types to target in vaccination and screening programs for cervical cancer prevention.
  • ➤ HPV types 16 and 18
  • ➤ 70% of cervical cancers

questions.text: The location of the cervical squamocolumnar junction (SCJ) varies with age and hormonal status. The SCJ tends to move outward onto the ectocervix, as in the example below, with which of the following conditions?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Pregnancy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ During periods of increased estrogen exposure , such as pregnancy , the squamocolumnar junction (SCJ) moves outward onto the ectocervix. This phenomenon is associated with the reproductive age group and estrogen-related changes in the cervix.
  • ➤ increased estrogen exposure
  • ➤ pregnancy
  • ➤ squamocolumnar junction (SCJ)

questions.text: Your patient is a 45-year-old with a Pap test result of high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion (HSIL). Subsequent colposcopy and cervical biopsy confirms a CIN 3 lesion; there is also histologic CIN 2 present in the endocervical curettage specimen. Which of the following is the most appropriate procedure for further diagnosis and/or treatment?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Loop excision

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of CIN 2 or 3 , the preferred treatment is loop excision (LEEP/LLETZ) , which removes the abnormal tissue and allows for histopathological evaluation to ensure complete removal and rule out invasive carcinoma. Ablative therapies like cryosurgery or laser ablation are not appropriate for high-grade lesions (CIN 2/3), and hysterectomy is reserved for more complex cases or when malignancy is strongly suspected.
  • ➤ CIN 2 or 3
  • ➤ loop excision (LEEP/LLETZ)
  • ➤ Ablative therapies

questions.text: Which of the following is the most commonly used radiation sensitizer for the treatment of cervical cancer?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Cisplatin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the treatment of cervical cancer , cisplatin is the most commonly used agent to enhance the effectiveness of radiation therapy . It plays a key role in chemoradiation protocols for improving outcomes in patients with locally advanced cervical cancer.
  • ➤ cervical cancer
  • ➤ cisplatin
  • ➤ radiation therapy
  • ➤ chemoradiation

questions.text: You are examining a 25y primigravida at 37 weeks pregnancy. The symphysio-fundal height is 32cm and the head is not engaged. What is the estimated fetal weight as calculated by Johnson’s formula?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 3100g

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Johnson's formula helps estimate fetal weight in the absence of ultrasound, using symphysio-fundal height measurements. For a high head (not engaged) , subtract 12 from the SFH, multiply the result by 155 , and for a low head (engaged) , subtract 11 .
  • ➤ Johnson's formula
  • ➤ symphysio-fundal height
  • ➤ high head (not engaged)
  • ➤ 12
  • ➤ 155
  • ➤ low head (engaged)
  • ➤ 11

questions.text: A 24y primigravida presents at 10 weeks pregnancy. She is worried as she has read about Down syndrome and wants to get the test done with the nest detection rate/ Which test will you offer her?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) NIPT

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For detecting Down syndrome , NIPT is the most accurate screening test with a 99% detection rate . It is non-invasive, safe, and can be done as early as 9 weeks of pregnancy , making it the best option for early detection of chromosomal abnormalities.
  • ➤ Down syndrome
  • ➤ NIPT
  • ➤ screening test
  • ➤ 99% detection rate
  • ➤ 9 weeks of pregnancy

questions.text: A 30y woman presents to the OPD at the primary health center with a h/o a missed period since 2 weeks. She suspects pregnancy. Her earlier cycles were regular. The health center has run out of urine pregnancy tests. Which of the following signs are you expected to see in this patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Hegar sign

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Hegar sign is an important early clinical sign of pregnancy, typically observed around 6-8 weeks . It is characterized by the softening of the lower uterine segment, detected via bimanual examination.
  • ➤ Hegar sign
  • ➤ 6-8 weeks

questions.text: A 25y primigravida presents to the OPD with a history of a dog bite. Her neighbor’s pet dog has bit her on the leg. She is currently 14 weeks pregnant. What is the next best step?

options.label: A
options.text: Clean the wound, administer tetanus and rabies vaccine

options.label: B
options.text: Clean the wound, administer only tetanus vaccine

questions.correct_answer: A. Clean the wound, administer tetanus and rabies vaccine
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Clean the wound, administer tetanus and rabies vaccine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Rabies vaccination is safe and recommended during pregnancy. For any dog bite or suspected rabies exposure, both tetanus and rabies vaccines should be administered, even in pregnant women, as the benefits far outweigh any potential risks.
  • ➤ Rabies vaccination
  • ➤ safe
  • ➤ dog bite
  • ➤ tetanus
  • ➤ rabies vaccines

questions.text: A 23y woman presents to the antenatal OPD at 16 weeks. On reviewing her history, she tells you she has been taking sertraline since a few months. She asks you what could be the potential effects of the drug on the fetus?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Congenital heart disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The use of SSRIs , particularly sertraline , during pregnancy is associated with a small increased risk of congenital heart disease , especially septal defects . Although SSRIs are relatively safe, this risk should be discussed with patients who are taking these medications during pregnancy.
  • ➤ SSRIs
  • ➤ sertraline
  • ➤ congenital heart disease
  • ➤ septal defects

questions.text: A woman reports to the antenatal OPD. A quadruple marker done at 16 weeks shows that the risk of having a baby with trisomy 21 is 1:67. What is the next best step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Amniocentesis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When a high-risk result for trisomy 21 is obtained from a quadruple marker test , the next best step is to perform a diagnostic test such as amniocentesis to confirm or rule out the chromosomal abnormality.
  • ➤ quadruple marker test
  • ➤ diagnostic test
  • ➤ amniocentesis

questions.text: Which is not a component of the quadruple marker?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Inhibin – B

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The quadruple marker test includes beta-hCG , unconjugated estriol , maternal serum AFP , and Inhibin-A . Inhibin-B is not part of this screening test.
  • ➤ quadruple marker
  • ➤ beta-hCG
  • ➤ unconjugated estriol
  • ➤ maternal serum AFP
  • ➤ Inhibin-A
  • ➤ Inhibin-B

questions.text: A 34-year-old woman with pre-eclampsia is induced at 37 weeks. After delivery what is the preferred uterotonic?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Oxytocin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For women with pre-eclampsia , oxytocin is the preferred uterotonic agent in the active management of the third stage of labor to prevent postpartum hemorrhage. Methylergometrine should be avoided in pre-eclampsia due to its hypertensive effects.
  • ➤ pre-eclampsia
  • ➤ oxytocin
  • ➤ active management of the third stage of labor
  • ➤ Methylergometrine

questions.text: How much fluid is instilled in this device when doing an intra-uterine tamponade for postpartum hemorrhage?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 500 ml

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Intrauterine tamponade devices, such as the Bakri balloon , are inflated with 300 to 500 ml of fluid to effectively manage postpartum hemorrhage by exerting enough pressure to stop the bleeding from uterine atony.
  • ➤ Bakri balloon
  • ➤ 300 to 500 ml of fluid
  • ➤ postpartum hemorrhage

questions.text: Obstetric shock index is defined as:

options.label: A
options.text: Maternal heart rate x systolic BP

options.label: D
options.text: Maternal heart rate x Mean arterial pressure

questions.correct_answer: B. Maternal heart rate/ Systolic BP
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Maternal heart rate/ Systolic Bullous Pemphigoid

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The obstetric shock index is defined as the maternal heart rate divided by the systolic blood pressure . A shock index >1 indicates the need for urgent interventions, such as blood transfusion and resuscitation, in obstetric patients.
  • ➤ obstetric shock index
  • ➤ maternal heart rate divided by the systolic blood pressure

questions.text: A 25y G2P1L1 is 36 weeks. Her blood group is B negative. The ICT is negative. When will you plan delivery?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 40 weeks

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For Rh-negative women who are not sensitized (negative ICT), delivery can be planned at 40 weeks to avoid unnecessary risk of fetomaternal hemorrhage while ensuring a safe gestational period.
  • ➤ Rh-negative
  • ➤ not sensitized
  • ➤ 40 weeks
  • ➤ fetomaternal hemorrhage

questions.text: 32 y G2 presents at 31 weeks with vaginal leaking. The uterus is relaxed and corresponds to 32 weeks gestation. FHR is 156bpm. There is no fever. What is the next best step?

options.label: A
options.text: Antibiotics, corticosteroids and induction of labor

options.label: B
options.text: Antibiotics, corticosteroids and induction of labor after 34 weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Antibiotics, corticosteroids and emergency LSCS at 37 weeks

questions.correct_answer: B. Antibiotics, corticosteroids and induction of labor after 34 weeks
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Antibiotics, corticosteroids and induction of labor after 34 weeks

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of preterm pre-labor rupture of membranes (PPROM) at 31 weeks, the best approach is to administer antibiotics and corticosteroids and monitor the mother and fetus. The goal is to delay delivery until 34 weeks to reduce neonatal complications unless signs of infection or fetal distress necessitate earlier delivery.
  • ➤ preterm pre-labor rupture of membranes (PPROM)
  • ➤ antibiotics and corticosteroids
  • ➤ 34 weeks

questions.text: A 27y lady presented with this USG image of her previous pregnancy where an MTP was done at 18 weeks. What is the best preconceptional advice you will offer this woman?

options.label: A
options.text: Refer to a fetal medicine expert

options.label: C
options.text: Folic acid 5 mg at least 3 months prior to conception

questions.correct_answer: C. Folic acid 5 mg at least 3 months prior to conception
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Folic acid 5 mg at least 3 months prior to conception

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For women with a previous pregnancy affected by neural tube defects (such as anencephaly), it is recommended to prescribe 5 mg of folic acid daily, starting at least 3 months before conception , to reduce the risk of recurrence.
  • ➤ neural tube defects
  • ➤ 5 mg of folic acid
  • ➤ at least 3 months before conception

questions.text: Identify the position:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) ROP

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In ROP (Right Occipito-Posterior) , the back of the fetal head (occiput) faces the right posterior of the maternal pelvis. Understanding fetal positioning is crucial for anticipating the progress of labor and any potential complications.
  • ➤ ROP (Right Occipito-Posterior)
  • ➤ right posterior

questions.text: What is the presenting diameter of the fetus in the attitude shown?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Occipito-frontal

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a deflexed head (military attitude), the presenting diameter is occipito-frontal , measuring around 11.5 cm . The presenting diameter varies based on the degree of flexion or extension of the fetal head, which influences the ease of delivery.
  • ➤ deflexed head
  • ➤ occipito-frontal
  • ➤ 11.5 cm

questions.text: A fetus diagnosed with neural tube defect at 21 weeks. The parents want an MTP at 21 weeks. What opinions are required?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Opinion of 2 doctors

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For pregnancies between 20 and 24 weeks , the opinion of two doctors is required to perform a medical termination of pregnancy, especially in cases where the fetus has a serious abnormality such as a neural tube defect .
  • ➤ 20 and 24 weeks
  • ➤ opinion of two doctors
  • ➤ neural tube defect

questions.text: A 27 y G2P1 with a previous cesarean section presents at 34 weeks. An ultrasound done at 30 weeks. She gives a history of painless vaginal bleeding at 30 weeks for which an ultrasound was done which showed the placenta is low lying and anterior. On examination, her PR – 80/ min, BP – 110/70mmHg. Abdominal exam reveals a uterus of 32 weeks, cephalic presentation and FHR – 150 bpm. What is the next best step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Order a color Doppler

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In patients with a history of placenta previa and previous cesarean section , the risk of placenta accreta increases. The best next step is to perform a color Doppler ultrasound to rule out placenta accreta spectrum disorders.
  • ➤ placenta previa
  • ➤ previous cesarean section
  • ➤ placenta accreta
  • ➤ color Doppler ultrasound
  • ➤ placenta accreta spectrum

questions.text: A 34y woman presents to the OPD with a history of 3 months amenorrhoea and mild vaginal bleeding. Her UPT is positive. She says an ultrasound was done a few days earlier but she has misplaced the report and has only the image as shown below. What is the next best step?

options.label: D
options.text: Call her after 2 weeks for review ultrasound

questions.correct_answer: C. Admit for suction and evacuation
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Admit for suction and evacuation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of suspected molar pregnancy (indicated by the snowstorm appearance on ultrasound), the definitive management is suction and evacuation . This prevents further complications and allows for monitoring of hCG levels to ensure complete resolution of the molar tissue.
  • ➤ molar pregnancy
  • ➤ snowstorm appearance
  • ➤ suction and evacuation

questions.text: The following maneuver is performed in which situation?

options.label: A
options.text: To deliver the after-coming head in breech delivery

options.label: B
options.text: To deliver nuchal arms in breech delivery

options.label: C
options.text: To keep the back anterior during breech delivery

options.label: D
options.text: To ensure enough space is there for applying forceps in breech delivery

questions.correct_answer: B. To deliver nuchal arms in breech delivery
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) To deliver nuchal arms in breech delivery

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Løvset maneuver is used during breech delivery to deliver nuchal arms . Understanding various maneuvers in breech delivery helps manage complications and ensure safe delivery for both the mother and baby.
  • ➤ Løvset maneuver
  • ➤ nuchal arms

questions.text: The following instrument is being used in the OT. In which of the following procedures is it likely to be used in?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Laparoscopic salpingectomy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The trocar and cannula are used in laparoscopic surgery to provide access to the abdominal cavity, allowing the introduction of the laparoscope and other instruments for minimally invasive procedures.
  • ➤ trocar and cannula
  • ➤ laparoscopic surgery

questions.text: A young recently married couple presents to the OPD. They give a history of unprotected intercourse twice in the last 3 days. Following the 1st episode 3 days back, the wife took the Emergency pill 12 h after intercourse. They again had unprotected intercourse 2 days later. What is the next best step?

options.label: A
options.text: Counsel her that the E-pill will be effective

questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Repeat the E-pill again

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Emergency contraception needs to be taken after each act of unprotected intercourse within the recommended time frame. The E-pill is effective for one episode, and a new dose is required for subsequent acts to prevent ovulation and potential pregnancy.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a risk factor for epithelial ovarian cancer?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Combined oral contraceptive pills

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Combined oral contraceptive pills reduce epithelial ovarian cancer risk by suppressing ovulation and decreasing epithelial cell turnover.

questions.text: What hormones are secreted by the Leydig cells and the Sertoli cells respectively?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Testosterone and AMH

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Leydig cells secrete testosterone, which is essential for the development of male internal genitalia, while Sertoli cells secrete anti-Müllerian hormone (AMH) to prevent the development of female reproductive organs.

questions.text: A 23y primi came to the emergency department at 35 weeks of pregnancy with pedal edema and BP of 140/90 mmHg. A urine dipstick was 2+. Her investigations are as listed below. Hb – 11.2g%, RBS – 123, SGOT – 25, SGPT- 30, Creatinine-0.7, platelet: 250000. What is the next best step?

options.label: B
options.text: Corticosteroids followed by induction of labor

questions.correct_answer: D. Induction of labor at 37 weeks
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Induction of labor at 37 weeks

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of mild pre-eclampsia , expectant management is the best approach. Delivery is planned for 37 weeks unless the condition worsens or develops into severe pre-eclampsia , at which point earlier delivery may be necessary. Antihypertensive treatment is reserved for blood pressures above 160/110 mmHg.
  • ➤ mild pre-eclampsia
  • ➤ 37 weeks
  • ➤ severe pre-eclampsia

questions.text: A 36y woman presents to the gyn OPD with secondary amenorrhoea. She has 1 child who is 8 years old, and she had a surgical termination of pregnancy done a year earlier. She says her mother attained menopause in her late thirties. Examination reveals a normal sized uterus, and no adnexal mass is palpable. Her pregnancy test is negative and her FSH is 6. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Asherman syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Asherman syndrome is a condition that occurs after uterine trauma, typically after procedures like D&C, leading to intrauterine adhesions and secondary amenorrhea.
  • ➤ Asherman syndrome

questions.text: As per the WHO Labor Care Guide, at what cervical dilatation should active phase begin?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 5 cm

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The active phase of labor begins at 5 cm of cervical dilatation, and recognizing this phase is important in managing labor progression and providing timely interventions if needed.
  • ➤ active phase of labor
  • ➤ 5 cm

questions.text: A 53y P1 presents to the OPD with a h/o post menopausal bleeding since a few days. She gives a history of traveling and attributes it to the stress. She attained menopause 1 year earlier. On examination, the cervix is normal and minimal blood is seen at the os. What is the next best step?

options.label: D
options.text: Review if another episode of bleeding

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Office endometrial biopsy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Postmenopausal bleeding should be investigated to rule out endometrial cancer . The next best step is an office endometrial biopsy or transvaginal ultrasound to assess the endometrial thickness and histological analysis.
  • ➤ endometrial cancer
  • ➤ office endometrial biopsy
  • ➤ transvaginal ultrasound

questions.text: Identify the hormone responsible for the rise in temperature as shown in the image:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Progesterone

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Progesterone is the hormone responsible for the rise in basal body temperature during the luteal phase of the menstrual cycle. This thermal shift occurs after ovulation and is a physiological marker of the luteal phase.
  • ➤ Progesterone
  • ➤ basal body temperature

questions.text: A 24y is referred for colposcopy from the primary health center in view of a suspicious looking cervix for which the midwife has sent you the image shown below. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Trichomonas vaginalis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Trichomonas vaginalis infection is associated with a "strawberry cervix" appearance, and it should be treated with metronidazole , with both the patient and partner treated to prevent reinfection.
  • ➤ Trichomonas vaginalis
  • ➤ metronidazole

questions.text: A 48y woman brings her 15y old daughter to the OPD. Her 65y old mother has been recently diagnosed with cervical cancer and she wants to enquire about the HPV vaccine for her and her daughter. What is the correct statement?

options.label: A
options.text: HPV vaccine for both the woman and her daughter is advised

options.label: B
options.text: HPV vaccine should be given only to her daughter

options.label: C
options.text: HPV vaccine should be given only to the woman

options.label: D
options.text: There is no role of the HPV vaccine

questions.correct_answer: B. HPV vaccine should be given only to her daughter
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) HPV vaccine should be given only to her daughter

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The HPV vaccine is recommended for girls and women between the ages of 9 and 26 years , and a catch-up vaccination is possible until 45 years with certain vaccines, although this is not universally applied in all countries. It is most effective when given before sexual activity begins to prevent HPV-related cancers and diseases.
  • ➤ HPV vaccine
  • ➤ 9 and 26 years
  • ➤ catch-up vaccination
  • ➤ 45 years

questions.text: A 27y woman presents to the emergency with severe abdominal pain. She gives a history of amenorrhoea of 2 months. On examination, her PR is 110/min, BP is 90/60mmHg. There is guarding on abdominal examination. Vaginal exam reveals mild tenderness with spotting. The internal os is closed. Her UPT is positive. What is the next best step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Urgent laparoscopy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of suspected ruptured ectopic pregnancy , indicated by severe abdominal pain, hemodynamic instability, and a positive pregnancy test, the immediate surgical intervention via laparoscopy (or laparotomy if laparoscopy is unavailable) is the preferred treatment.
  • ➤ suspected ruptured ectopic pregnancy
  • ➤ immediate surgical intervention

questions.text: A 23y woman present with a missed abortion at 8 weeks and is planned for a suction evacuation. Which of the following instruments will you not use?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Uterine sound

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ During suction evacuation for early missed abortions, a uterine sound should be avoided due to the risk of uterine perforation , especially in early pregnancy. All other instruments, including the MVA syringe , Karman cannula , and uterine curette (blunt end), are used as part of the procedure.
  • ➤ suction evacuation
  • ➤ uterine sound
  • ➤ uterine perforation
  • ➤ MVA syringe
  • ➤ Karman cannula
  • ➤ uterine curette

questions.text: Which of the following is commonly associated with this type of pelvis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Obstructed labor

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The android pelvis , characterized by a heart-shaped structure and prominent ischial spines , is commonly associated with obstructed labor due to its restrictive shape, which hinders the smooth descent of the fetal head.
  • ➤ android pelvis
  • ➤ heart-shaped
  • ➤ prominent ischial spines
  • ➤ obstructed labor

questions.text: A 35y woman presents to the emergency with severe dysmenorrhoea not responding to NSAIDs. She gives a history of worsening dysmenorrhoea and also has pain when passing stools. She does not give a history of constipation. Her periods are otherwise regular. On bimanual examination, the uterus is fixed and retroverted. On further history, she reveals that she hasn’t conceived despite being married for 3 years for which she was planning to show the gynecologist. What is the probable diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Endometriosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Endometriosis should be suspected in women presenting with chronic pelvic pain, dysmenorrhea, dyspareunia, and infertility , particularly when a fixed retroverted uterus is noted on examination. Dyschezia (pain with defecation) is another common symptom when endometrial implants involve the rectal area.
  • ➤ Endometriosis
  • ➤ chronic pelvic pain, dysmenorrhea, dyspareunia, and infertility
  • ➤ fixed retroverted uterus
  • ➤ Dyschezia

questions.text: A 24y woman presents to the antenatal OPD. She is 3 months pregnant. On asking, she tells you that she has a 4 year old son followed by a twin pregnancy which she terminated at 8 weeks. What is her obstetric formula?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) G3P1A1

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Gravida refers to the total number of pregnancies, Para refers to the number of pregnancies that reached viability, and Abortions refers to pregnancies that ended before viability. In this case, the woman is G3P1A1 : three pregnancies, one viable, and one abortion.
  • ➤ Gravida
  • ➤ Para
  • ➤ Abortions
  • ➤ G3P1A1

questions.text: A 30 y primigravida with GDM has just delivered by forceps. Following delivery of the placenta, there is sudden severe bleeding. The uterus is well contracted. PR is 100, BP is 90/60mmHg. Immediate resuscitation is done. Blood transfusion is started. What is the next best step?

options.label: B
options.text: Examine for vaginal and cervical tears

questions.correct_answer: B. Examine for vaginal and cervical tears
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Examine for vaginal and cervical tears

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When postpartum hemorrhage occurs and the uterus is well contracted, the most likely cause is trauma (e.g., vaginal or cervical tears). The next step is to examine the birth canal for any lacerations and manage accordingly.
  • ➤ trauma
  • ➤ examine the birth canal

questions.text: A 21y unmarried girl presents to the OPD with increasing weight gain and acne. On asking, she says her period are regular. On examination, her BMI is 28. An ultrasound reveals the following in 1 ovary. What is the best treatment option?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Optimize BMI

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For women with PCOS and a BMI above the normal range , lifestyle modification and weight loss are the first-line treatments. These measures can significantly improve metabolic, reproductive, and dermatologic symptoms without needing immediate pharmacologic intervention.
  • ➤ PCOS
  • ➤ BMI above the normal range
  • ➤ lifestyle modification
  • ➤ weight loss

questions.text: A 75-year-old woman with complaints of mass per vaginum, as shown in the below image was posted for operative repair. During the pre-anesthetic check-up, she was found to be unfit for major surgery. Which of the following procedures is recommended for her?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Colpocleisis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Colpocleisis is an appropriate surgical option for elderly women with advanced uterine prolapse who are no longer sexually active and are unfit for major surgery. It is a less invasive procedure with minimal risks, making it suitable for those with significant medical comorbidities.
  • ➤ Colpocleisis

questions.text: Maximum causes of female infertility are attributed to which cause?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ovarian causes, such as ovulatory disorders, are the leading contributors to female infertility, followed by tubal causes. Understanding the underlying factors is crucial for appropriate diagnosis and treatment in fertility management.

questions.text: A mother brought her 16-year-old daughter to the hospital with complaints of primary amenorrhea. On evaluation axillary and pubic hair were present and other secondary sexual characteristics normal. LH and FSH levels are normal, and USG shows an absent uterus. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) MRKH syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ MRKH syndrome is characterized by the presence of normal secondary sexual characteristics, normal hormone levels, and the absence of the uterus or part of the vagina in an individual with a 46,XX karyotype. It is one of the most common causes of primary amenorrhea with normal secondary sexual development.

questions.text: In which of the following conditions, a hysteroscopy can be done?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Asherman syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hysteroscopy is an effective tool for diagnosing and treating intrauterine conditions such as Asherman syndrome. It allows direct visualization of the uterine cavity and can be used therapeutically for adhesiolysis, polypectomy, and resection of intrauterine fibroids.

questions.text: A 23-year-old woman accompanied by her mother-in-law comes to the infertility clinic. She has been having regular intercourse for 6 months but is not able to conceive. What is the next best step?

options.label: B
options.text: Reassure and review the couple after 6 months

questions.correct_answer: B. Reassure and review the couple after 6 months
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Reassure and review the couple after 6 months

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In women under 35, infertility is defined as the inability to conceive after 12 months of unprotected intercourse. It is appropriate to reassure and wait before starting any diagnostic tests or treatments. For women over 35 or with known risk factors, earlier investigation may be warranted.

questions.text: The filter used in a colposcope is a green filter. A green filter is used because?
questions.correct_answer: D. Vascular patterns are seen better
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Vascular patterns are seen better

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The green filter in colposcopy helps improve the visibility of vascular patterns, which can be indicative of abnormal changes such as cervical dysplasia or cancer.

questions.text: A 23y school teacher is 12 weeks pregnant. A child in her class develops chickenpox and she comes to the OPD as she has been exposed to the child. She does not give a history of ever having chicken pox in the past. What is the next best step?

options.label: A
options.text: Urgent fetal medicine referral for a detailed ultrasound

questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Varicella zoster immunoglobulin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of chickenpox exposure in pregnancy, the first step is to determine the woman's immunity. If she is not immune, varicella zoster immunoglobulin (VZIG) should be administered to prevent or reduce the severity of the infection. Immediate medical interventions aim to protect both the mother and the fetus from complications.
  • ➤ varicella zoster immunoglobulin (VZIG)

questions.text: A 25y G2P1 has delivered. Following delivery, despite waiting for 30 mins, the placenta has not separated. There is no excessive bleeding and the patient is stable. What is the next best step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Manual removal of placenta

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of retained placenta, where the placenta has not separated after 30 minutes post-delivery, manual removal of the placenta is the next best step to prevent complications such as postpartum hemorrhage or infection. Crede’s maneuver is no longer recommended due to the risks it poses.
  • ➤ manual removal of the placenta

questions.text: A 30y primi presents at 32 weeks for a routine checkup. On examination, the uterus is 28 weeks. The fetal parts are not easily palpable, and the fetal heart rate is heard quite clearly. An ultrasound is ordered. Which of the following will you expect to find on the ultrasound?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) AFI < 5

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Oligohydramnios , or low amniotic fluid volume (AFI < 5), can present with a uterine size smaller than the gestational age and difficulty palpating fetal parts. It is commonly diagnosed via ultrasound and requires close monitoring to avoid complications.
  • ➤ Oligohydramnios

questions.text: Endometriosis can be seen with which of the following Mullerian anomalies?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Transverse vaginal septum

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A transverse vaginal septum can obstruct menstrual outflow, increasing the risk of retrograde menstruation , which is a potential cause of endometriosis. Recognizing Mullerian anomalies that obstruct menstrual flow can help in diagnosing conditions like endometriosis.
  • ➤ transverse vaginal septum
  • ➤ retrograde menstruation

questions.text: Which is incorrect about the umbilical cord?

options.label: A
options.text: Hyper and hypo-coiling are both associated with poor fetal outcome

options.label: B
options.text: A 2-vessel cord is associated with congenital abnormalities

options.label: C
options.text: The umbilical arteries carry deoxygenated blood

options.label: D
options.text: True knots are more common in diamniotic twins

questions.correct_answer: D. True knots are more common in diamniotic twins
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) True knots are more common in diamniotic twins

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ True knots of the umbilical cord are more common in monoamniotic twins , not diamniotic twins, due to their shared amniotic sac, which allows for greater cord entanglement.
  • ➤ True knots
  • ➤ monoamniotic twins

questions.text: A 34y P2L2 wants a contraceptive. She enquires about Antara. All are true about Antara except?

options.label: A
options.text: Cannot be given in lactating women

options.label: C
options.text: It is given once in 3 months

options.label: D
options.text: There is a delay in return to fertility

questions.correct_answer: A. Cannot be given in lactating women
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Cannot be given in lactating women

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Antara (DMPA) is a progesterone-only injectable contraceptive that can be safely used in lactating women and may cause irregular vaginal bleeding. There is a delay in return to fertility after stopping Antara, and it is administered once every 3 months .
  • ➤ Antara (DMPA)
  • ➤ lactating women
  • ➤ delay in return to fertility
  • ➤ once every 3 months

questions.text: A 20y G2P1 is in active labor. The CTG is as shown. What is is the likely interpretation?
questions.correct_answer: C. The head is descending down
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) The head is descending down

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Early decelerations on a CTG trace are typically caused by fetal head compression during labor, which is a normal part of the second stage of labor as the head descends. This pattern is generally benign and not associated with fetal distress or hypoxia.Bottom of Form
  • ➤ Early decelerations
  • ➤ fetal head compression
  • ➤ benign

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding the umbilical artery Doppler done ins a 24y primi with FGR at 32 weeks as shown below?

options.label: A
options.text: This is absent end systolic flow

options.label: B
options.text: This is reversed end diastolic flow

options.label: C
options.text: This finding is normal at 32 weeks gestation

options.label: D
options.text: This pattern indicates decreased resistance to umbilical artery blood flow

questions.correct_answer: B. This is reversed end diastolic flow
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) This is reversed end diastolic flow

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Reversed end-diastolic flow in the umbilical artery Doppler indicates severe placental insufficiency and increased resistance to blood flow, commonly seen in cases of fetal growth restriction (FGR) . It is a serious finding that often requires urgent management to prevent adverse fetal outcomes.
  • ➤ Reversed end-diastolic flow
  • ➤ severe placental insufficiency
  • ➤ increased resistance
  • ➤ fetal growth restriction (FGR)

questions.text: A 23y primigravida presents for induction of labor at 41 weeks. Her Bishop score is 3. You proceed with cervical ripening using the agent shown below. What group of drugs does this belong to?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Prostaglandins

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Prostaglandins , particularly misoprostol (PGE1) and dinoprostone (PGE2) , are effective agents used for cervical ripening in labor induction. These drugs promote the softening and dilation of the cervix, especially in patients with a low Bishop score.
  • ➤ Prostaglandins
  • ➤ misoprostol (PGE1)
  • ➤ dinoprostone (PGE2)
  • ➤ cervical ripening

questions.text: On performing a laparoscopic procedure for an ectopic pregnancy, the following image was seen at the hepatic area. What could have been the possible cause of the ectopic pregnancy?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) PID

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fitz-Hugh-Curtis syndrome , characterized by violin-string adhesions , is associated with Pelvic Inflammatory Disease (PID) . PID is a major risk factor for ectopic pregnancy , as it leads to scarring and damage in the fallopian tubes.
  • ➤ Fitz-Hugh-Curtis syndrome
  • ➤ violin-string adhesions
  • ➤ Pelvic Inflammatory Disease (PID)
  • ➤ ectopic pregnancy

questions.text: A 23y primigravida presents at 8 weeks pregnant. She is troubled by constant nausea and vomiting which occurs 2-3 times a day but she is able to keep her food down and is tolerating oral fluids. Which is the drug of choice for this patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Pyridoxine + Doxylamine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pyridoxine + Doxylamine is the first-line treatment for nausea and vomiting in pregnancy due to its proven efficacy and safety profile.
  • ➤ Pyridoxine + Doxylamine
  • ➤ nausea and vomiting in pregnancy

questions.text: A 30y primigravida presents for her regular antenatal checkup at 32 weeks. On examination, the fundal grip reveals a hard ballotable structure. What is your inference?

options.label: A
options.text: The fetus is in cephalic presentation

options.label: B
options.text: The fetus is in breech presentation

options.label: C
options.text: The fetus is in transverse lie

options.label: D
options.text: The presentation cannot be made out

questions.correct_answer: B. The fetus is in breech presentation
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) The fetus is in breech presentation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The presence of a hard, ballotable structure at the fundus during Leopold’s maneuvers typically indicates breech presentation , as the fetal head is located at the top of the uterus.
  • ➤ hard, ballotable structure at the fundus
  • ➤ breech presentation

questions.text: Which of the following infertility scenarios would warrant intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI)?

options.label: B
options.text: Infertility secondary to diminished ovarian reserve

options.label: C
options.text: Infertility secondary to bilateral distal fallopian tube occlusion

options.label: D
options.text: Infertility secondary to the male partners severe oligospermia

questions.correct_answer: D. Infertility secondary to the male partners severe oligospermia
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Infertility secondary to the male partners severe oligospermia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ ICSI is primarily indicated for male factor infertility , particularly in cases of severe oligospermia , where sperm count is critically low or motility is poor, necessitating the direct injection of sperm into the egg to achieve fertilization.
  • ➤ ICSI is primarily indicated for male factor infertility
  • ➤ severe oligospermia

questions.text: A patient is being evaluated for urinary incontinence following a hysterectomy. In the 3-swab test, the upper swab is wet. What is the diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Uretero-vaginal fistula

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The 3-swab test is a diagnostic method used to locate the site of genitourinary fistulas. A wet upper swab without blue staining suggests a uretero-vaginal fistula , whereas a middle or lower swab stained with methylene blue suggests fistulas originating from the bladder or urethra, respectively.
  • ➤ 3-swab test
  • ➤ wet upper swab without blue staining
  • ➤ uretero-vaginal fistula
  • ➤ middle or lower swab
  • ➤ methylene blue

questions.text: A 32-year-old woman presents at 7 days postpartum after an uneventful cesarean section with complaints of swelling and pain in her left leg. options.label: B

Ans. B) Start low molecular weight heparin (LMWH) and continue for at least 6 weeks

  • • LMWH is the first-line treatment for postpartum DVT because: It is safe in breastfeeding. It has predictable pharmacokinetics, does not require routine monitoring, and has a lower risk of bleeding compared to unfractionated heparin. A minimum of 6 weeks of anticoagulation is recommended postpartum to reduce the risk of recurrence, though therapy may be extended up to 3-6 months depending on risk factors.

It has predictable pharmacokinetics, does not require routine monitoring, and has a lower risk of bleeding compared to unfractionated heparin. A minimum of 6 weeks of anticoagulation is recommended postpartum to reduce the risk of recurrence, though therapy may be extended up to 3-6 months depending on risk factors.

Additionally, warfarin requires frequent INR monitoring, which can be cumbersome in the early postpartum period. It is safe in breastfeeding but not preferred as an initial treatment.

questions.text: Your patient, who is pregnant with an estimated gestational age of 7 to 8 weeks by last menstrual period, presents to the emergency department with heavy vaginal bleeding and passage of tissue. In contrast, complete moles are p57 negative . Understanding the pathology and immunohistochemistry of molar pregnancies helps differentiate between complete and partial moles, which is essential for management and follow-up.
  • ➤ Partial molar pregnancies

  • ➤ complete moles
  • ➤ p57 negative

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of suspected ectopic pregnancy (early pregnancy with pain and vaginal bleeding), a transvaginal scan is the most sensitive diagnostic tool for confirming the location of the pregnancy, especially when a transabdominal scan is inconclusive.
  • ➤ transvaginal scan

questions.text: Which of the following medical therapies has been associated with a modest decrease in the incidence of pre-eclampsia in women at increased risk?

options.label: C
options.text: Both aspirin and Low molecular weight heparin

questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Low dose Aspirin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In women at increased risk for pre-eclampsia, low-dose aspirin initiated before 16 weeks of pregnancy has been shown to modestly decrease the incidence of pre-eclampsia.
  • ➤ low-dose aspirin
  • ➤ 16 weeks of pregnancy

questions.text: A 34y woman has PPH. Surgical devascularization is being done as shown. Which vessel is being ligated in the image?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Utero-ovarian

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The utero-ovarian anastomosis is a significant vascular connection that supplies blood to both the uterus and ovaries. In cases of severe postpartum hemorrhage, ligating this vessel can help control bleeding while preserving ovarian function.

questions.text: A 28-year woman with infertility presents to you. On ultrasound there is an intramural fibroid measuring 7 x 5 cm near the right cornua and another intramural fibroid measuring 5 x 5 cm near the left cornua. HSG reveals bilateral tubal block at the region of the tubal ostia. Semen parameters are normal and there is no ovulatory disturbance. What is the BEST management for this woman?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Laparoscopic myomectomy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In women with infertility, large intramural fibroids that distort the uterine cavity or block the fallopian tubes, especially those larger than 5 cm, should be surgically removed to improve fertility. Laparoscopic myomectomy is the preferred approach in such cases.

questions.text: A 49y woman presents with decreased interest in sexual intercourse for 6 months. She also complains of recent onset painful intercourse, and this has further decreased her interest. She had a laparoscopic hysterectomy at 40y for adenomyosis. The ovaries were conserved. On examination, the vulva has scant pubic hair and the vulvo-vaginal mucosa is pale. The uterus is absent and there is no significant finding on bimanual exam. Which investigation will help diagnose her condition?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Serum FSH

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In women approaching menopause or with postmenopausal symptoms, serum FSH levels can help confirm the diagnosis of menopause, especially when ovarian function is in question following hysterectomy with ovarian conservation.
  • ➤ serum FSH

questions.text: An average woman is expected to experience how many ovulatory events during her reproductive lifetime?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 400

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ An average woman ovulates around 400 times during her reproductive lifespan, which lasts from menarche to menopause.

questions.text: Which of the following sonographic endometrial thickness measurements is commonly used as a threshold to indicate a low risk for endometrial hyperplasia or cancer?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 5mm

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ An endometrial thickness of 5mm or less on transvaginal ultrasound is associated with a low risk of endometrial hyperplasia or cancer in postmenopausal women, and further diagnostic procedures are often unnecessary unless there are other risk factors or symptoms.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding sexual differentiation in humans?

options.label: A
options.text: The SRY acts as a testis-deleting factor (TDF)

options.label: B
options.text: Without the influence of SRY, gonads develop as testes

options.label: C
options.text: The gene is located on the Y chromosome and is named the sex-determining region of the Y (SRY)

options.label: D
options.text: The presence or absence of gonadal determinant genes is not thought to determine fetal gender

questions.correct_answer: C. The gene is located on the Y chromosome and is named the sex-determining region of the Y (SRY)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) The gene is located on the Y chromosome and is named the sex-determining region of the Y (SRY)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The SRY gene located on the Y chromosome plays a critical role in sexual differentiation by triggering the development of testes, which is essential for male sex determination in humans.
  • ➤ SRY gene

questions.text: During the physical examination for chronic pelvic pain, the technique shown here should be included. Nodularity may be found most commonly with which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Endometriosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Nodularity or tenderness in the pouch of Douglas is most commonly associated with endometriosis , and it is a key finding on pelvic examination when evaluating chronic pelvic pain.
  • ➤ endometriosis

questions.text: A 52-year-old woman is diagnosed with cervical cancer with spread to the right pelvic side wall. Her IVP shows right sided hydroureteronephrosis. Cervical biopsy confirms that it is a poorly differentiated carcinoma. What is the likely stage?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Stage 3B

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Stage 3B cervical cancer involves spread to the pelvic side wall and/or the presence of hydronephrosis. Hydroureteronephrosis is a key indicator that the cancer has obstructed the ureter, which automatically classifies the disease as Stage 3B.
  • ➤ Stage 3B

questions.text: Match the following scenarios with the likely hormonal profile?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 1-a, 2-d, 3-c, 4-b

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In Kallmann syndrome , there is a deficiency in GnRH leading to low LH, FSH, and estradiol. MRKH syndrome is associated with normal ovarian function and hence normal hormone levels. Turner syndrome shows elevated LH and FSH with low estradiol due to ovarian failure, and PCOS often has increased LH with normal FSH and estradiol.
  • ➤ Kallmann syndrome
  • ➤ MRKH syndrome
  • ➤ Turner syndrome
  • ➤ PCOS

questions.text: The most common etiologies of bleeding have been correctly paired with their age demographic in all except which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Menopause—endometrial carcinoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Understand that postmenopausal bleeding is most often caused by endometrial atrophy , with endometrial carcinoma being less common but still an important differential diagnosis.
  • ➤ postmenopausal bleeding
  • ➤ endometrial atrophy
  • ➤ endometrial carcinoma

questions.text: A patient came to the gynecology OPD with complaints of foul-smelling frothy vaginal discharge and intense itching. On examination, the cervix was spotted and had the appearance of a strawberry. Identify the causative organism:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Trichomonas vaginalis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Trichomonas vaginalis is associated with frothy vaginal discharge , itching , and the strawberry cervix appearance, which are key diagnostic clues for trichomoniasis.
  • ➤ Trichomonas vaginalis
  • ➤ frothy vaginal discharge
  • ➤ itching
  • ➤ strawberry cervix

questions.text: A G2P1 presents at 28 weeks. On examination, the uterus is 24 weeks. On ultrasound there is absent liquor. Which could be the most likely cause?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Fetal renal anomalies

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fetal renal anomalies are the most common cause of absent or reduced amniotic fluid (oligohydramnios) because the fetus cannot produce urine, which is the main component of amniotic fluid after mid-pregnancy.
  • ➤ Fetal renal anomalies
  • ➤ absent or reduced amniotic fluid

questions.text: Which is a contra-indication to the contraception shown?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Trophoblastic disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Gestational trophoblastic disease is a contraindication for intrauterine device (IUD) placement because of the increased risk of complications such as infection and uterine perforation.Bottom of Form
  • ➤ Gestational trophoblastic disease

questions.text: A 34y P1 has started using the combined oral contraceptive pill for family planning. Since she is new to the method, she skips 3 pills in the 1st 2 weeks and approaches the primary health center and asks if there is a possibility of pregnancy. What is your advice?

options.label: A
options.text: Take the last missed pill as soon as possible and continue the remaining packet

options.label: B
options.text: Take the last 2 missed pills as soon as possible, use an additional method for 7 days and take the emergency contraceptive pill

options.label: C
options.text: Take the last missed pill as soon as possible, use an additional method for 7 days and take the emergency contraceptive pill

options.label: D
options.text: Take the last missed pill as soon as possible, use an additional method for 7 days, take the emergency contraceptive pill and skip the pill free interval

questions.correct_answer: C. Take the last missed pill as soon as possible, use an additional method for 7 days and take the emergency contraceptive pill
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Take the last missed pill as soon as possible, use an additional method for 7 days and take the emergency contraceptive pill

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In case of missing 3 or more COC pills in the first 2 weeks, take the last missed pill, use an additional contraceptive method for 7 days, and consider emergency contraception to reduce the risk of pregnancy.

questions.text: Collapse in a patient during labor/ delivery followed by bleeding and DIC in the absence of coexisting conditions is most likely due to:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Amniotic fluid embolism

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Amniotic fluid embolism is a rare, life-threatening condition that presents with sudden cardiovascular collapse, respiratory distress, and DIC during or immediately after labor, without any preexisting conditions.

questions.text: Identify what is being done on palpation:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Uterine height

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Palpation of the uterine height helps estimate the fundal level, assisting in monitoring fetal growth and the progression of pregnancy.

questions.text: A 30y G2 presents in labor at 38 weeks. A partogram is shown below. Mark the best management for the patient:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Cesarean section

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of labor where there is fetal distress, inadequate descent of the fetal head, and a lack of engagement, an emergency cesarean section is often indicated, especially when there are no clear signs that vaginal delivery would be safe or imminent.

questions.text: A 22 y recently married woman presents to OPD with 6 weeks of amenorrhea. She complains of mild abdominal pain and vaginal spotting. A UPT is positive. A TVS shows a normal uterus with b/l normal ovaries. A beta hCG is done which is 346. A repeat beta hCG after 48h is 420. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases where a patient presents with early pregnancy symptoms (amenorrhea, abdominal pain, and spotting), an ectopic pregnancy should be considered if the beta hCG levels rise inadequately (less than 60% increase in 48 hours) and no intrauterine gestation is visualized on ultrasound.

questions.text: A 28-year-old G3P2L2 woman presented to the antenatal OPD at 36 weeks of amenorrhea. Ultrasound shows that the fetus is in a transverse lie. The liquor is adequate, the placenta is normal, and she has no gross anomaly. Both her previous deliveries were normal vaginal deliveries. How will you manage this patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) External cephalic version

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For patients at 36 weeks of gestation with a fetus in a transverse lie, external cephalic version (ECV) should be attempted if there are no contraindications, such as placental abnormalities or fetal distress. This can potentially allow for a vaginal delivery and avoid the need for a cesarean section.
  • ➤ external cephalic version (ECV)

questions.text: A 23y woman has received 2 doses of Gardasil. She is due for her 3rd dose but has since gotten married and is now 10 weeks pregnant when she presents for her 3rd dose. What is the next best step?

options.label: B
options.text: Give the 3rd dose of Gardasil after 12 weeks

options.label: C
options.text: Withhold the 3rd dose of Gardasil, repeat the entire vaccination schedule after delivery

options.label: D
options.text: Withhold the 3rd dose of Gardasil, repeat the 3rd dose after delivery

questions.correct_answer: D. Withhold the 3rd dose of Gardasil, repeat the 3rd dose after delivery
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Withhold the 3rd dose of Gardasil, repeat the 3rd dose after delivery

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In pregnant women, the HPV vaccination series should be postponed until after delivery . If a woman becomes pregnant before completing the series, the remaining dose(s) should be given postpartum, and there is no need to restart the entire series .
  • ➤ HPV vaccination series
  • ➤ postponed until after delivery
  • ➤ no need to restart the entire series

questions.text: A patient was undergoing a hysteroscopic removal of a submucosal fibroid, in which a fluid deficit of 2000 mL is estimated in a patient. What is the immediate complication of this?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Pulmonary edema

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pulmonary edema is a known complication of fluid overload during hysteroscopic procedures, especially when there is a large fluid deficit (over 1000 mL). Monitoring fluid input and output is essential during hysteroscopy to avoid such complications.
  • ➤ Pulmonary edema
  • ➤ fluid overload
